answers.answer: GBS can come and go at anytime 15% of women that tested positive at 36 weeks tested negative during labor. This is why I don't do the test. Most likely you will test negative again.

They told me that since i tested positive the first time 36 weeks  i still will need to be treated even if i tested negative 37 +2 the second time i kinda confused on what to do if its not showing now y should i be given antibiotics

I tested positive with my last pregnancy and woth this one. You can have them retest you if you'd like. Like she says ^ you could have it one week and not the next... I did all my research on it. I didn't get the antibiotics with my last child. He didn't sick. My water literally broke and he was born within minutes. He had barely if any contact. I'm hoping this birth goes about the same. :) Either way good luck mama!!

I would argue with them if I were you!!! They can not base it off an old test that's like women that take the 1 hour glucose test and it coming back positive and then you retaking it doing the 3 hour one and it comes back negative and they say "well the first one came back positive so you have gestational diabetes" they are trying to make money off of you but diagnosing you with something you don't have!!

question: And then test negative at 37 weeks. The only reason they tested me again is bc im allergic to penicillin .so  now should i get treated or get tested again kind of confused?
title: GBS did anybody test positive at their 36week
